com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.networkclasses.retrofitutilities

Class RetrofitErrorHandling

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pgmacdesign.pgmacutilities.networkclasses.retrofitutilities.RetrofitErrorHandling

  • public class RetrofitErrorHandling
extends java.lang.Object
    This class will handle Retrofit errors (ErrorBodies) Created by pmacdowell on 8/29/2016.

      • getErrorBody

        public static okhttp3.ResponseBody getErrorBody(retrofit2.Response response)
        Checks the Response for an error body
        Parameters:
        response - Response from Retrofit. Response
        Returns:
        ResponseBody (Error body) from OKHttp ResponseBody

      • parseBooleanResponse

        public static java.lang.Boolean parseBooleanResponse(retrofit2.Response response)
        This will attempt to parse the errorReponse into a single Boolean. This is a less preferable method to use in that it simply checks for 'equalsIgnoreCase' as opposed to parsing individual Strings. I recommend you use parseErrorResponse() methods instead and use this only if you are certain you will ONLY be receiving back a simple boolean response from the server
        Parameters:
        response - The Retrofit Reponse to parse Response
        Returns:
        String with the error body String. If a parsing error occurrs, it will return null

      • parseErrorResponse

        public static java.lang.String parseErrorResponse(retrofit2.Response response)
        This will attempt to parse the errorReponse with no class to compare against. It will pull back a String to return error body. See ResponseBody for more info
        Parameters:
        response - The Retrofit Reponse to parse Response
        Returns:
        String with the error body String. If a parsing error occurrs, it will return null

      • parseErrorResponse

        public static java.lang.Object parseErrorResponse(retrofit2.Response response,
                                                  java.lang.Class parsingClass)
        This will custom parse an error response with your own class passed in as the parsing class. An example would be a class that matches the error response from a server. todo add sample parsing error class here for visual
        Parameters:
        response - Response to parse Response
        parsingClass - Class that matches the server's return json data model for parsing
        Returns:
        Returns an Object matching the parsingClass structure if it parses correctly. If not, it will send back null.

      • getReturnCode

        public static int getReturnCode(retrofit2.Response response)
        Simpler error code handler. Use this in confunction with other things
        Parameters:
        response - Response
        Returns:
        integer
